headline: Exclusive: Former Intel CEO Craig Barrett outlines plan to save Intel and America’s advanced chip manufacturing
summary: Intel needs a cash infusion of roughly $40 billion to remain at the leading edge of chip manufacturing, according to former CEO Craig Barrett. The U.S. government is unlikely to be the main savior—instead cash rich chip customers like Nvidia, Apple, and Google need to step up.

raw.headline: Exclusive: Former Intel CEO Craig Barrett outlines plan to save Intel and America’s advanced chip manufacturing
raw.summary: Intel needs a cash infusion of roughly $40 billion to remain at the leading edge of chip manufacturing, according to former CEO Craig Barrett. The U.S. government is unlikely to be the main savior—instead cash rich chip customers like Nvidia, Apple, and Google need to step up.

headline: Intel's CEO to Visit White House on Monday: WSJ
summary: Intel's CEO Lip-Bu Tan is expected to visit the White House on Monday for a meeting with President Trump, according to a report in The Wall Street Journal.  Trump singled-out the CEO last week, posting on his social media account that Tan should resign from the chip maker over questions about his ties to China.  The Intel executive is expected to have a wide-ranging talk with Trump, the Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter, including about his personal and professional background.

raw.headline: Intel's CEO to Visit White House on Monday: WSJ
raw.summary: Intel's CEO Lip-Bu Tan is expected to visit the White House on Monday for a meeting with President Trump, according to a report in The Wall Street Journal.  Trump singled-out the CEO last week, posting on his social media account that Tan should resign from the chip maker over questions about his ties to China.  The Intel executive is expected to have a wide-ranging talk with Trump, the Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter, including about his personal and professional background.

headline: Intel CEO to visit White House on Monday, WSJ reports
summary: Intel and the White House did not immediately respond to requests for comment.  Tan is expected to have an extensive conversation with Trump while looking to explain his personal and professional background, the report said, adding that he could propose ways Intel and the U.S. government could work together, the report added.  Tan hopes to win Trump's approval by showing his commitment to the U.S. and guaranteeing the importance of keeping Intel's manufacturing capabilities as a national security issue, the report added.

headline: Intel CEO Singled Out by Trump to Visit White House on Monday
summary: Intel  CEO  Lip-Bu Tan  is set to visit the White House Monday after President  Trump  called for his removal last week over ties to Chinese businesses, according to people familiar with the matter.  Tan is expected to have a wide-ranging conversation with Trump, with the intent of explaining his personal and professional background, the people said.  Tan hopes to win Trump’s approval by showing his commitment to the country and pledging the importance of keeping Intel’s manufacturing capabilities as a national security issue, one of the people said.

raw.headline: Intel CEO Singled Out by Trump to Visit White House on Monday
raw.summary: Intel  CEO  Lip-Bu Tan  is set to visit the White House Monday after President  Trump  called for his removal last week over ties to Chinese businesses, according to people familiar with the matter.  Tan is expected to have a wide-ranging conversation with Trump, with the intent of explaining his personal and professional background, the people said.  Tan hopes to win Trump’s approval by showing his commitment to the country and pledging the importance of keeping Intel’s manufacturing capabilities as a national security issue, one of the people said.

headline: How once-iconic Intel fell into a 20-year decline
summary: Its CEO is under fire. It has lost its edge. And it's still the only U.S. company with the know-how to make leading-edge chips in America.

raw.headline: How once-iconic Intel fell into a 20-year decline
raw.summary: Its CEO is under fire. It has lost its edge. And it's still the only U.S. company with the know-how to make leading-edge chips in America.

headline: Intel: More Work To Do
summary: Intel struggles to capitalize on the AI boom, with modest revenue growth but declining profits. Find out why INTC stock is a Hold.
